title: Several of energy companies are trading lower after amid API reported an 8.42 million barrel build in crude oil inventories, as well as market weakness as investors await today's Federal Reserve decision and update on the state of the economy.

Shares of several energy companies are trading lower as equities sell off following the recent rally. Stocks have rallied over the past week amid optimism towards the US economy reopening and investors have potentially taken some profits following the run up.
Shares of several energy companies are trading higher amid a gain in oil prices following positive US jobs data and as investors await the OPEC+ conference, hoping for output cuts.

Shares of several oil and energy companies are trading higher amid multiple positive catalysts. Economic recoveries in the US and China have lead to a positive demand outlook, while investors also watch for developments concerning OPEC+ production cut talks.
Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading higher as oil prices gain ahead of the OPEC+ output cut meeting expected this week.
Shares of several energy companies are trading higher after API and EIA data showed a draw in US crude inventories.
Shares of several oil & gas stocks are trading higher amid an increase in the price of oil driven by greater-than-expected production cuts.
Shares of several energy companies are trading lower. Despite EIA reporting a draw in crude inventories, OPEC cut its 2020 oil demand forecast by 2.2 million barrels per day.

Shares of several energy companies are trading higher after US unemployment figures came in below consensus estimates. Equities have been strong this week amid a rebound in oil prices and some US states easing lockdown restrictions.

Shares of several oil companies are trading higher as oil prices gain. Strength in oil prices is being driven by production cuts, price raises from Saudi Arabia and a rebound in gasoline demand as some states and countries reopen economies.
Shares of several energy companies are trading higher as oil prices continue to rebound on hopes of output cuts as well as some US states reopening their economies, which could lift demand.
Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading lower on market weakness as investor uncertainty grows following quarterly earnings results from multiple companies.

Shares of several oil companies are trading higher as oil prices gain after EIA reported a smaller-than-expected build in crude inventories. Positive sentiment also potentially being driven by some US states reopening and positive trial data from Gilead's coronavirus treatment candidate.
Shares of several energy companies are trading higher for the session as some US states ease lockdown restrictions and as investors weigh quarterly earnings from blue chip companies.
Shares of several energy companies are trading higher as oil prices potentially stabilize following recent crash.
Afternoon Market Stats in 5 Minutes
Shares of several energy companies are trading lower as oil prices collapse amid high supply. The coronavirus pandemic has led to a sharp decline in oil demand.
Shares of several energy companies are trading lower after OPEC further cut global oil demand forecasts.
Shares of several oil stocks are trading lower amid a decline in the price of oil after the International Energy Agency said demand for the commodity is expected to reach a 25-year low.

Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading higher on expectations of an oil output cut by major producers. OPEC countries have scheduled an urgent meeting next week to try and resolve their oil cut dispute.

Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading higher after President Trump said he expects Russia and Saudi Arabia to announce a 10 million barrel supply cut.
Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading higher after President Trump said he expects Russia and Saudi Arabia to end their oil price war within a few days.

Shares of several oil and energy companies are trading higher after US President Trump and Russian President Putin agreed to talks with the aim of stabilizing energy markets. Oil has been hurt this year by lower demand as well as a price conflict between Russia and Saudi Arabia.
Shares of several oil and gas stocks are trading lower following a significant decline in the price of oil due to increased speculation oil demand will fall as a result of coronavirus.

Shares of several oil companies are trading lower, selling off from Thursday's strength. While US stimulus legislation has boosted economic optimism, demand concerns still exist amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Shares of several oil companies are trading higher amid renewed economic optimism following US Senate passage of an economic stimulus plan. NOTE: The sector is mixed, with some names down for the session amid falling crude futures.

Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading lower as growing coronavirus fears continued to hamper oil demand outlook.

Shares of oil & gas companies are trading higher on preliminary Phase One US-China trade agreement.
Shares of oil & gas companies are trading higher following multiple positive US-China trade developments, including a tweet from President Trump suggesting the US is 'very close' to a deal.
Shares of oil and gas companies are trading higher after OPEC and OPEC+ agreed to further oil production cuts.

Shares of oil companies are trading higher following a larger-than-expected draw in US crude inventories as well as positive US-China trade reports and anticipation of further OPEC production cuts this year.

Shares of several oil & gas companies are trading lower as economic concerns from China outweighed bullish signs from its refining sector. China's economic growth slowed to 6% year-over-year in the third quarter, its weakest in approximately 27 years.

Shares of several oil & gas companies are trading lower as the vague U.S.-China trade deal failed to meet expectations amongst companies and investors. The continued uncertainty around the deal is hindering the global economy and the demand for oil.

Shares of oil and gas companies are trading higher in sympathy with the overall market after President Trump made positive remarks on US-China trade talks. NOTE: The price of oil has continued to trade higher after the price per barrel broke the $54 resistance level.

Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading higher after multiple reports indicating China is open to a partial trade deal surfaced. The reports renewed optimism in the upcoming U.S.-China trade talks.
Shares of oil companies are trading lower following a larger-than-expected build in US crude inventories. Additionally, overall market weakness and recession fears are weighing on oil demand outlook.
Shares of oil and gas companies are trading lower following worse-than-expected US PMI data. Weak economic indicators can weigh on oil and gas, as they are used as industrial inputs.

Shares of many oil & gas companies are trading higher due to heightened tensions following an attack on a Saudi Arabian oil field supposedly by Iran. NOTE: The strike on the oil field has disrupted about half of Saudi Arabia's oil production equivalent to 5% of the daily global oil supply.

Shares of several oil & gas companies are trading higher after the new Saudi energy minister said there would be no radical change in the country's oil policy and the deal to cut oil production by 1.2 million barrels per day will stay.

Shares of several Oil & Gas companies are trading lower potentially following a report from Reuters indicating oil producers & suppliers cut budgets, staffs, and production goals amid growing consensus of forecasts that oil and gas prices will stay low.

Shares of several oil & gas companies are trading higher after the EIA reported a crude inventory draw of 4.771 million compared to the 2.488 million draw estimate. A larger-than-expected draw is seen as a sign of oil demand increasing.
Shares of several oil stocks are trading higher due to an oil price increase after industry data showed a decline in US oil reserves.
Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading higher following API and EIA data showing bigger-than-expected crude inventory withdrawals.
Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading higher after OPEC delivered a bearish 2019 oil market outlook, which may prompt further supply cuts.

Shares of several oil & gas companies are trading lower as concerns of a recession continue to grow. EIA on Wednesday also reported a US crude oil inventory build of 1.58 million barrels vs a draw of 2.775M barrels estimate.
Shares of several oil & gas companies are trading lower with the overall market following US and UK yield curve inversions, which have raised concerns of a recession.

Shares of several oil companies are trading higher as oil prices rise after API and EIA data showed a larger-than-expected crude draw for the week ended July 5.

Shares of several oil & gas companies are trading lower as oil prices dipped on demand concerns from ongoing U.S.-China trade tensions; the trade tensions continue to drag the world economy, ultimately lowering the demand for oil.

Shares of several Oil and Gas companies are trading lower as concerns that the global economy could be slowing outweigh news of an agreement by OPEC and allies, including Russia, to extend supply cuts until next March.
Shares of several oil companies are trading higher after IEA reported a much larger-than-expected draw in crude oil inventories.

Shares of several oil companies are trading higher as oil rises after Iran shot down a US drone, increasing supply uncertainty in the Middle East. Renewed hopes of a Fed rate cut this year have also raised economic outlook, which could drive oil demand.

Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading lower following negative oil price catalysts. EIA on Wednesday cut 2019 demand forecasts while there was a reported increase in crude inventories. US-China trade tensions have weighed on demand outlook.
Many US-traded stocks are trading higher as recent economic signals have raised the potential for a Federal Reserve rate cut.

Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading higher amid eased trade tensions after China's Commerce Ministry stated they are open to dialogue to resolve trade tensions. Mexican officials also said they could find common ground with the US.
Shares of several oil companies are trading higher as oil prices rise after Saudi Arabia indicated OPEC producers will continue to limit oil output in order to avoid a surplus.
Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading lower after oil prices fell following a report from the USA EIA showing smaller-than-expected crude oil and gas inventory draws.

Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading lower on continued US-China trade tension after the Trump administration said it would add up to 5 more Chinese surveillance companies to the blacklist.
Shares of many oil and gas companies are trading higher as crude oil has remained largely over $63 per barrel for the last four sessions.
Shares of many oil and gas companies are trading higher as crude oil has remained mostly over $63 per barrel for the last four sessions.

Shares of several oil and oil services companies are trading higher as oil prices rise. Armed attacks on Saudi pumping stations have caused supply uncertainty, while renewed US-China trade optimism has boosted demand outlook.

Shares of several companies in the oil sector are trading lower amid a drop in oil prices after the Energy Information Administration reported a rise in crude inventories.
Shares of several oil stocks are trading higher on an increase in the price of crude oil due to an expected announcement from the US that buyers of Iranian oil need to end imports or face sanctions.
